articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits January 18 General Machinery Plant and Sets forth Tasks for Its Modernization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits January 18 General Machinery Plant and Sets forth Tasks for Its Modernization
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the January 18 General Machinery Plant and specified tasks and ways for its modernization.
					 He went round the newly-built revolutionary museum.
					
					 He said that the plant successfully built the interior of the museum and displayed well historic mementoes and relics. "As I always emphasize the key to increased production lies in directing sustained big efforts to the ideological education to give fullest play to the mental power of the workers," he added.
					
					 He continued:
					
					 "The January 18 General Machinery Plant is the eldest brother-like plant and a heart-like plant in developing the nation's machine-building industry and the Party attaches great importance to this plant.
					
					 I came here today to turn the plant into a model one, a pivotal and core one representing the machine plants of our country".
					
					 Noting that it is the intention of the Party to modernize the plant at the highest level, he gave precious instructions to do so.
					
					 "The plant should put the production processes on a CNC and unmanned basis in order to boost the production of highly efficient machine products needed by various fields of the national economy and achieve successes in the work for developing new varieties of products," he stressed.
					
					 He set the goals to be attained by the plant in the near future and promised with loving care to solve all the problems arising in updating it including the provision of all latest equipment needed for it.
					
					 He gave an instruction to fundamentally face-lift the environment of the plant.
					
					 He instructed the plant to draw a clear line of distinction between the district for production and that for workers' living and radically face-lift not only all production buildings but cultural and welfare facilities so that what is standing today may be in sharp contrast to those built in the past from the viewpoint and stand of building a new plant from scratch.
					
					 He called for building not only welfare and service facilities such as Kangsong Health Complex but also hostel, nursery and kindergarten at the highest level.
					
					 He stressed the need to build well a scientific and technological disseminating room where not only scientists and technicians but workers can acquire wide-ranging science and technology so as to make the flames of the mass technological innovation movement rage at the plant.
					
					 "It is of particular importance to successfully design and construct structures if the January 18 General Machinery Plant is to be built as a structure of lasting value which will remain impeccable even in the distant future", he said, adding that he would send the plant  a prestigious national design group and powerful construction force of the People's Army.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Ryom Chol Song, Yun Tong Hyon, Hong Yong Chil and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Air and Anti-Air Force Unit 447
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Air and Anti-Air Force Unit 447
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, inspected KPA Air and Anti-Air Force Unit 447 honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment.
					 After receiving a salute, he shook hands with commanding officers one by one. He said he came to the unit to meet its human bomb-like fighters and airmen who creditably performed their difficult combat flight mission with high awareness to devotedly defend the country. "Whenever I visit the airfield where airmen are active, I feel as if I were entering the yard of my old home," he added.
					
					 He highly praised the unit, saying the unit which produced 14 human bomb-like fighters is the unit which gave origin to the heroic, self-sacrificing and self-blasting spirit of the brave red hawks of Songun Korea.
					
					 Watching the monument to field guidance given by the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he looked back with deep emotion on the glorious road covered by the unit.
					
					 Looking round the plane personally watched by the great Generalissimos, he praised the unit for maintaining with good care the plane and always keeping it fully ready to make sortie and thereby letting it take the lead in flight drills at all times.
					
					 He dropped in at the flight training room and watched with great attention airmen undergoing training with the help of ground piloting training equipment.
					
					 It is necessary to intensify training in order to shed less blood in battle, he noted, calling upon airmen to intensify the training so that they may satisfactorily perform combat flight mission including take- off and landing under the worst conditions.
					
					 He said that airmen should make it part of their life and habit to undergo training with the help of modern piloting  training equipment while flying aircraft a lot and thus make the unit intensify the training  the way the anti-Japanese guerrillas did in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 He handed to the unit reference books prepared by him, underlining the importance to manufacture better piloting training equipment in order to conduct the ground training under the simulated conditions of an actual battle.
					
					 Going round various places including airmen's bedroom, he paid deep attention to the living of airmen.
					
					 He spared time to watch an art performance given by airmen of the unit and their wives.
					
					 He said watching the simple performance truthfully representing their life, he could witness the intense loyalty of the airmen and their wives to the party. He congratulated them on their successful performance and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Ryom Chol Song, Jo Kyong Chol, Yun Tong Hyon, Hong Yong Chil and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Heads of State of Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Heads of State of Various Countries
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent messages to heads of state of various countries in reply to their messages of greetings on the occasion of the Day of the Sun (birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung).
					 They were President of Myanmar Thein Sein, Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad, Pakistani President Mamnoon Hussain, Kazakh President Nursultan Nazarbayev and Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni.
					
					 The reply messages expressed deep thanks to the presidents for their sincere congratulations and best wishes on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					
					 They expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and the relevant countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to Cambodian King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Samdech Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, on his 61st birthday.
					 The message extended warm congratulations and greetings to the king.
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided and developed by the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il together with the respected His Majesty Great King Norodom Sihanouk would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the king bigger success in his noble work for the country's prosperity and people's happiness.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Sudanese Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Sudanese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Omer Eisa Ahmed, Sudanese ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Namibian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Namibian President
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission (NDC), received congratulatory message from Hifikepunye Pohamba, president of Namibia, on April 15.
					 The Namibian president in his message congratulated Kim Jong Un on his reelection as first chairman of the NDC of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of Namibia and on his own behalf.
					
					 The message said that Kim Jong Un's reelection as first chairman of NDC of the DPRK is an expression of the trust in him by the DPRK government wanting him to continue working for its people.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and hoped that he would dynamically lead the DPRK people to greater economic prosperity and social progress.

articles.title: Secretary General of SWAPO Interviewed by KCNA
articles.content:
Secretary General of SWAPO Interviewed by KCNA
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Secretary General Nangolo Mbumba, who is leading the visiting delegation of the South West Africa People's Organization of Namibia, was interviewed by KCNA before flying back.
					 He said that he was deeply impressed by what he witnessed in the DPRK.
					
					 He noted that the genuine happiness of the Korean people would be unthinkable without the great leaders.
					
					 It is fortune and honor for the Korean people to hold the great leaders in high esteem, he said.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il made energetic efforts to build a genuine state for the people on this land and developed it into a powerful state, he noted.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 They were peerlessly great men as they performed great feats in the efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Their cause is now being successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He is energetically leading various sectors including national defence and economy.
					
					 The solid foundation of the independent and modern national defense industry and the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un provide the key to bringing the defence capabilities of the DPRK on a fairly high level.
					
					 All successes made by the DPRK are greatly inspiring us, he added.

articles.title: Namibian Party Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Namibian Party Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The South West Africa People's Organization (SWAPO) of Namibia led by Secretary General Nangolo Mbumba left here for home on Wednesday.

articles.title: Men's Soccer Finals Held
articles.content:
Men's Soccer Finals Held 
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Men's soccer games of the second round of the premier league of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games ended. 
					 Finals between the April 25 Team and Amnokgang Team took place at the Kim Il Sung Stadium on Wednesday. 
					
					 The April 25 Team defeated its rival 1:0.
					
					 Before the finals a match was held between the Kigwancha Team and the Sobaeksu Team. The Kigwancha Team defeated its rival 1:0. 
					
					 In the second round games the April 25 Team took the first place and the Amnokgang and Kigwancha teams the second and third places. 
					
					 The April 25 Team took the first place and Amnokgang and Sobaeksu teams second and third places in the total standings of the men's soccer games of the premier league of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games.

articles.title: 17th Pyongyang Spring Int'l Trade Fair
articles.content:
17th Pyongyang Spring Int'l Trade Fair
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The 17th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair (May 12-15) goes on at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House here.
					 Taking part in the fair are more than 300 trading companies from different countries and regions, which presented products with high competitiveness in electronic, machinery, metal, building-material, transport, light, food and consumer goods industries.
					
					 The ongoing fair is held at two halls of the exhibition house--the New Technology Innovation Hall and the Heavy Industry Hall--unlike the past fairs for its growing scale. Hundreds of pavilions were installed on the ground and first floors of the New Technology Innovation Hall and vehicles of various kinds displayed at its outdoor stands. Exhibited at the Heavy Industry Hall were garments, textile goods, medicines, etc.
					
					 The fair is more diverse in style of display than the past, and it witnesses more active consultation among companies for economic and technological exchanges and businesses.
					
					 In the fair, businesspersons from Asia and Europe have expressed their willingness to strengthen the economic trade in various fields with the DPRK, appreciating its economic successes.
					
					 Dr. Bernhard Loy, international sales manager of Germany's Denk Pharma, told KCNA: "Our intention is to provide our quality medicine to the Korean people and this is why we are looking for reliable partner who is willing to buy our products at a reasonable price."

articles.title: Physical Training Center in Pyongyang Starts Service
articles.content:
Physical Training Center in Pyongyang Starts Service
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Physical Training Center in Chongchun Street of Pyongyang started its service after being remodeled on a modern basis.
					 The center is equipped with tens of kinds of apparatuses for physical training and body building.
					
					 Its Director Ri Hyon Il told KCNA:
					
					 The center serves for sportspersons and fans to have their physical training and body building on a scientific basis.
					
					 Its training rooms are designed in a peculiar way to ensure convenience on the highest level and raise the effectiveness of physical training.
					
					 It has various welfare service facilities such as bathroom and soft drink restaurant.
					
					 The center is now drawing an increasing number of visitors.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats in Developing Juche-oriented Literature and Art
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats in Developing Juche-oriented Literature and Art
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- "The Sea of Blood" is one of the great masterpieces President Kim Il Sung created during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					 After penetrating into the requirements of developing Juche-oriented literature and art, leader Kim Jong Il initiated its filmization in April Juche 57(1968), as part of efforts to make a radical turn in developing the literature and art.
					
					 He gave detailed guidance to making the movie of "The Sea of Blood" from the composition of its script to its direction and filming.
					
					 Thanks to his energetic guidance, the film "The Sea of Blood" was successfully produced, touching the heartstrings of all people from its premiere.
					
					 The film still serves as a textbook in developing the Juche-oriented literature and art as it fully embodies the requirements of the Juche idea in its content, form, film-making and other fields.

articles.title: Masterpieces Created by Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Masterpieces Created by Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il created many masterpieces.
					 "Song of Korea" was created by Kim Il Sung in his early period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle. This revolutionary song which restored the name of the country is a monumental work which gave origin to the Juche-based poetry.
					
					 He created revolutionary drama "Three Pretenders" and song and dance "Maypole" during the days when he explored the path of the Korean revolution.
					
					 "The Flower Girl" raised its first curtain in Wujiazi during the anti-Japanese armed struggle. It aroused many Kkotpunis suffering all sorts of pain and misfortune after losing the country to the struggle for human emancipation, class liberation and national liberation, sowing flower seeds of revolution.
					
					 Kim Il Sung visited the International Friendship Exhibition House in October, Juche 68 (1979) and recited "Mt. Myohyang on an Autumn Day".
					
					 He wrote poem "Shining Star" on the occasion of the 50th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il. It wishes the bright future of the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 In his teens Kim Jong Il created child poems "Portrait" and "Our Leader", drama "The Torch in Pochonbo" and dramatic literature "The End of the Defeated General".
					
					 "Song of Best Wishes" created by him on June 1, 1953 represents the highest cream of all people's wishes to hold the leader of the revolution in high esteem for all ages.
					
					 Child poem "May a Second Become an Hour" and songs "Azalea" and "My Mother" reflect the noble thought of a peerlessly great man.
					
					 Child poem "Our Classroom" and poems "Greeting the Sun Rising over the Taedong River", "I Will Carry on the March Started from Mt. Paektu" and "The Most Beautiful Rivers and Mountains" reflect the faith and will of Kim Jong Il to carry forward and accomplish the Juche cause and the revolutionary cause of Songun generation after generation, holding Kim Il Sung in high esteem.
					
					 "The Embrace of My Motherland" clarifies the idea that the motherland of the Korean people precisely means the leader and he is the embrace of the motherland.
					
					 "Where Are You, Dear General?" and "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee" created by Kim Jong Il while indicating the way of Juche-based music with the song of the leader as the core are being loudly sung on the road of the advance of the new century of Juche.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams Kim Min Sok's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Kim Min Sok's Reckless Remarks 
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Min Sok, the spokesman for the south Korean puppet Ministry of Defense, seems to be tired of living.
					 He is dancing a sword dance while denying the existence of fellow countrymen in a broad daylight though the whole of south Korea has turned into a mourner's house after hundreds of students were buried at the seabed. How can he behave so if he is not an idiot.
					
					 At a regular news briefing he shouted hoarse to dare slander the DPRK as a "country that can hardly be called a country". He went the lengths of talking such rubbish that "it is a country which should disappear at an early date".
					
					 It is pitiful that an imbecile unable to discern the cardinal points is busy kicking off deranged hysteria, regardless of time. 
					
					 No wonder, even south Korean public termed his remarks "nonsensical ones excessively rattling the nerves of the north".
					
					 As there goes a saying that a crow cannot be whiter for often washing, Kim Min Sok, steeped in the enmity towards fellow countrymen in the north, let loose a spate of invectives against them on different occasions, spoiling the atmosphere  for mending the  inter-Korean relations.
					
					 After the National Defence Commission of the DPRK made a crucial proposal to the south Korean authorities early this year and proposed taking practical steps for improving the inter-Korean relations, Kim blustered that the U.S.-south Korea Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises would be staged as scheduled and the puppet forces would "make an immediate counterattack without slight hesitation".
					
					 He told journalists on April 22 rubbish that "there would happen something alarming before April 30", floating a rumor about an imminent nuclear test of the DPRK.
					
					 What matters is that Kim, a fool, is speaking for the military of the Park Geun Hye regime.
					
					 What he uttered reflects the last-ditch efforts of the sinking Park regime.
					
					  The puppet group, the arch criminal who turned the whole of south Korea into a sea of tears due to the ferry Sewol sinking disaster, is making desperate efforts to calm down the angry and grieving people.
					
					 It is greatly vexed by the stirring reality of the DPRK, its dynamism and might of single-minded unity quite contrary to what is happening in south Korea.
					
					 The Park group is much upset by the happy laughter and songs of children heard from the Songdowon International Children's Camp, the result of the noble loving care of the Workers' Party of Korea for the rising generation and the future.
					
					 The malignant vitriol let loose by the group against the dignified DPRK is also aimed at getting rid of the overall crisis caused by dependence on foreign forces and acts of treachery and escaping a miserable defeat in the forthcoming local election.
					
					 The group, seized with extreme fear and uneasiness, is putting forward such bad guy as Kim in a bid to escalate all-out confrontation with the DPRK. This is as foolish an act as jumping into fire with faggot on its back.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to behave with discretion in face of the current crisis.
					
					 If the Park regime is to prolong its remaining days even a bit, it should sternly punish at once Kim Min Sok who brought misfortune to the nation. This is the only way out not only for the Ministry of Defense but for Chongwadae.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Foreign Minister for Reckless Remarks for Confrontation with DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Foreign Minister for Reckless Remarks for Confrontation with DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, puppet foreign minister of south Korea during his recent visit to the U.S. was busy himself to make an open speech and an invitation address in which he clamored that the north's access to nuclear weapons will "deteriorate tensions and instability" in Northeast Asia.  
					 The traitor claimed that if the north conducts a nuclear test, the "international community should resolutely cope with it" and slap "sanctions of other form stronger than the preceding one" against it and the north should pay "dearest price".
					
					  Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					  Yun's hysteria is the pitiful behavior of the U.S. colonial stooge who lost his sound judgment, engrossed in hostility towards compatriots and dependence on foreign forces.
					
					 Yun is working hard to pass the buck for tensions upon the DPRK, but he can never cover up bellicose nature of the puppet forces to ignite a war for aggression, backed by the U.S.
					
					 Yun's coarse assertion for "international community's strong counteraction" and "dearest price" goes to clearly prove that the Park Geun Hye group's sinister intention to do harm to the compatriots by relying on outside forces is entering into a very dangerous stage.
					
					 It is very justifiable that the DPRK expressed its stand that it would respond to the aggressive challenge of hostile forces with the measure for self-defence including nuclear test of new form.
					
					 The puppet forces are seriously mistaken if they calculate they can arrest the DPRK's advance by slapping sanctions against it together with outside forces.
					
					 They should clearly understand that their frantic moves for confrontation with the DPRK in league with outside forces would bring only miserable ruin to them.

articles.title: U.S. Should Not Deceive Reality: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Should Not Deceive Reality: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Officials of the U.S. State and Defense Departments recently vied with each other to admonish "north Korea to exercise a self-restraint to refrain from acts escalating tensions" and assert that "the U.S. remains unchanged in its stand for the denuclearization of the Korean peninsula."
					 The U.S. even called on the DPRK to return to the NPT and fulfill its commitments when it made appearance at an international meeting.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary terms this another deceptive farce fabricated by the Obama group, much upset by the DPRK's clarification of its toughest stand.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The U.S. brands acts to defend one's own inviolable country and territory from outside aggression as a "provocation" and "threat" and justifies a gangster-like act of kicking up a war racket in other's land. This is a shameless act of making a profound confusion of the right and wrong. 
					
					 Clear is the aim sought by the U.S. in clamoring for "restraining from provocative acts" and "honoring the commitments". This is aimed to continue to provoke the DPRK, lead it to military countermeasures and thus brand it as a "belligerent" country and justify Washington's military moves.
					
					 But the U.S. is seriously mistaken. Its true colors as a provoker and aggressor harassing peace and stability on the Korean peninsula are being brought to light.
					
					 We have nothing to hide or make up. We have already declared that the main target of our diversified nuclear strike means is the U.S. Now that the U.S. conducts joint military exercises, a test nuclear war targeting the DPRK, in south Korea every year, we will continue to conduct nuclear and missile tests to cope with them.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Denounces Puppet Group for Causing Uneasiness and Division
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Denounces Puppet Group for Causing Uneasiness and Division
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, south Korean internet newspaper, in an editorial denounced the puppet group of south Korea for causing uneasiness and division on May 10.
					 The editorial said on May 9 Park Geun Hye suggested "a draft measure for improving people's livelihood" the keynote of which is to lend funds to travel, transport and lodging businesses and ensure the circulation of the funds in the areas of Jin Island and Ansan.
					
					 This policy will saddle minor business people and common people with debts again, the editorial said, adding:
					
					 This shows that Park who is accustomed to blaming others is attributing economic stagnation to the sinking of the ferry.
					
					 The major cause of the economic downturn is the authorities' unpopular rule as evidenced by the widening gap between the rich and the poor due to the expansion of the part-time jobs.
					
					 It is worth recalling that Park held a "meeting for taking measures for improving people's livelihood" at a time when the bereaved families of the victims of Sewol disaster anxiously asked for an interview with the "president" outside Chongwadae.
					
					 Park is herself hurling mud at the angry bereaved families and other people.
					
					 The current social uneasiness was caused by the "government" which has neither capability nor will to protect the lives of the people.
					
					 The spokesman for Chongwadae declared that they would meet only members of bereaved families. The authorities branded those who hoped for the safe return of those who went missing as the "forces following the north". This is the cause of the social division.
					
					 The "government" does not bring any hope to the people. Yet, it urges them to stay calm and not to conduct agitation, far from coming out to protect the lives of the people and ensure their security. That's why the people no longer pin hope on such a "government".
					
					 The only option is to come out to defend one's own life and security.

articles.title: Opening to Public Videos on Ferry Sewol Sinking Disaster Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Opening to Public Videos on Ferry Sewol Sinking Disaster Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The consultative council of organizations for records management in south Korea held a press conference in Jongro District, Seoul on May 12 demanding the puppet authorities clearly probe the truth behind the ferry Sewol sinking accident, according to south Korean KBS.
					 In the press conference, speakers said that all the people including the bereaved families do not believe in the regime because it is not opening to public all videos on the disaster.
					
					 They urged the authorities to immediately open to public videos.

articles.title: Over 20,000 S. Korean People Launch Candlelight Action
articles.content:
Over 20,000 S. Korean People Launch Candlelight Action
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- A candlelight rally was held in Ansan of Kyonggi Province on May 10 to honor the memory of the victims of the ferry Sewol sinking disaster and probe the truth about it, according to the south Korean Internet newspaper Thongil News.
					 Present there were more than 20,000 people from across south Korea.
					
					 The participants honored the memory of those who died grievous deaths in the ferry sinking accident.
					
					 The venue of the rally was filled with wailing of bereaved families calling their children and family members.
					
					 A member of the bereaved families read out a letter addressed to his son who was a student of Tanwon Senior High School.
					
					 Members of various civil and social bodies made speeches.
					
					 Speakers deplored that they would not have been grieved so much if the disaster were the natural one.
					
					 They denounced the authorities for claiming that those young people out in the memorial service were mobilized after receiving money and they are "the forces following the north". 
					
					 They said: "Do not stay quiet. Let's take action. Let's fundamentally change the wrong society." They declared that they would hold more events for mourning the victims and fight it out to thoroughly probe the truth behind the disaster and punish those responsible for it.
					
					 A joint action declaration of the Ansan civic and public solidarity for settling the issue of the ferry Sewol sinking accident was read out at the rally.
					
					 The declaration called upon the people to turn out in a large-scale candlelight action for probing the truth behind the accident, instituting a law for supporting the bereaved families and the survivals and punishing those responsible for the disaster.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Encroaching upon Freedom of Expression
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Encroaching upon Freedom of Expression
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- More than 10 media, teachers and human rights organizations of south Korea including the Teachers Union held a press conference in protest against the puppet group's encroachment upon freedom of expression, according to south Korean CBS on May 12.
					 In the press conference, speakers said that the authorities are deploying policemen in the Jindo Gymnasium and other parts and threatening those sponsors of the rally for honoring the memory of the victims of the ferry Sewol sinking disaster while watching bereaved families and citizens.
					
					 The Broadcasting and Communication Committee is enforcing news censorship and the ministries and agencies of the regime are quelling the people's anger through internet, they charged.
					
					 They urged the authorities not to encroach upon freedom of expression related to the ferry sinking accident.

articles.title: Actions for Probe into Truth behind Ferry Disaster Called for
articles.content:
Actions for Probe into Truth behind Ferry Disaster Called for
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, south Korean internet newspaper, in an editorial on May 12 called for actions for the probe into the truth behind the ferry Sewol sinking disaster and the punishment of the responsible ones.
					 The editorial continued:
					
					 Students, religionists and other people are turning out in the actions, raising shouts of anger at the joint incense-burning altars outside Chongwadae, Kwanghwamun in Seoul and KBS broadcasting service and in other parts of south Korea.
					
					 This is an expression of indignation at the maritime police which assigned the rescue operation to the civilians even though they could save the passengers on board, at the bureaucrats and the media which kowtow to the power rather than allaying the pain of the families who lost their children and at Park Geun Hye who does not feel even an iota of sense of responsibility.
					
					 This being a hard fact, Park is talking about "measures for disaster control system" while turning a deaf ear to the voices of the bereaved families and other people demanding the probe into the truth and the punishment of those responsible for the disaster.
					
					 Public view that the "government" will hamper the efforts to probe the cause of the sinking disaster and call to task those responsible for it is becoming a reality. Concealment of the truth can never be allowed before the children who met deaths for believing in the words "Stay calm."
					
					 Without the probe into the truth and the punishment of those responsible for the disaster, the souls of children still lingering in the land of the dead can never find safe havens.
					
					 The conservative ruling quarters seek to downplay the public anger over the Sewol disaster with the building up of the public opinion and deceptive tricks through reptile media and have the election to local self-governing bodies carried out successfully. But this time they can not be allowed to do so.
					
					 The editorial stressed the need to judge the incompetent "government" and prevent grievous deaths from happening again on this land.

articles.title: Quick Involvement of Maritime Police Could Have Saved All Passengers Aboard: S. Korean Newspaper
articles.content:
Quick Involvement of Maritime Police Could Have Saved All Passengers Aboard: S. Korean Newspaper
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News in an article titled "Quick involvement of maritime police could have saved all passengers aboard" carried on its May 12th issue blasted the maritime police for shunning the rescue operation.
					 It said:
					
					 There is information proving that right before the sinking of the ferry the maritime police had 47 minutes enough to have access to the ferry and rescue the passengers, but it did not start the rescue operation, simply looking through broken windows.
					
					 A person concerned of the prosecution-police joint investigation headquarters for the sinking of ferry Sewol clarified on May 11 that at 9:30 on April 16 last month when the maritime police arrived at the scene first, the ferry was tilted about 45 degrees, adding that if the maritime police had immediately started the rescue operation, all passengers on board could have been rescued.
					
					 The maritime police had access to Sewol by a helicopter and a warship before others but they only rescued the captain, crewmen and some passengers.
					
					 The police could speak to passengers over microphone from the steering house of the ferry, etc. to guide them to escape. But the police did not tell even the rescued crewmen to do so.
					
					 They also had time enough to enter the hull of the ferry and guide the passengers to escape and give help in the rescue operation though it was hard for it to make such broadcasting, according to the analysis made by the investigation headquarters.
					
					 Passengers aboard anxiously asked for help over cell phones, etc. being trapped inside while the maritime police rescued only crewmen after giving up the entry into the hull.
					
					 The rescue operation could have been possible even at 10:17 a.m. when a student of Tanwon high school sent his last message. 
					
					 The newspaper clarified that evidence proving that the maritime police shunned the rescue operation was disclosed.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Should Be Held Accountable for Sewol Ferry Sinking: Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Should Be Held Accountable for Sewol Ferry Sinking: Koreans in U.S.
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The actions of Koreans in the U.S. critical of the Park Guen Hye's regime are gaining in scope and strength in the wake of ferry Sewol sinking accident, according to Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the U.S.
					 More than 300 Korean women in the U.S. and members of civic movement organizations gathered outside the puppet Consulate General in Los Angeles on May 10 and honored the memory of the school children who died in the ferry sinking accident.
					
					 They staged a demonstration, holding slogans "Corrupt and incompetent Park Geun Hye should step down", "We will die if we keep mum again" and "We denounce Park".
					
					 At the end of the demonstration, the speakers denounced the Park regime for failing to save the people from death.
					
					 The ferry sinking accident is the tragedy which should not be overlooked and Park is wholly to blame for it.
					
					 They declared they would share pain with the mothers who lost their children and carry on their actions till Park steps down.
					
					  Meanwhile, Koreans in the U.S. had full page ads titled "Park should probe the truth" denouncing the Park group carried in the May 11th issue of the New York Times.

articles.title: Nigerian Organization Supports Appeal of Regional Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Nigerian Organization Supports Appeal of Regional Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association released a statement on May 8 responding to the appeal of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association positively supports the appeal sent by the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea to foreign organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people on the occasion of the 20th demise anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 We will inaugurate a Nigerian national committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung and organize colorful events including meeting, film show and photo exhibition to widely introduce his brilliant revolutionary career and immortal exploits.
					
					 We will take an active part in an international Internet seminar on the great career and immortal exploits of the President to be held late in June or early in July.
					
					 The Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association will as ever praise the President on several occasions and extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle for building a thriving nation and reunifying the country true to the noble intention of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Nigerian Organization Introduces Korean Workers
articles.content:
Nigerian Organization Introduces Korean Workers
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- An article titled "Working Class of the DPRK" was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on May 5.
					 The article said that the workers in the DPRK enjoy a dignified life as masters of the state and society.
					
					 Among them are labor heroes, deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) and singers who are couples of workers loved by the people, it noted.
					
					 It introduced in detail U Won Yong, merited coal miner of the Pukchang Area Coal-Mining Complex, and Mun Kang Sun, weaver of the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, who are labor heroes and deputies to the SPA, and Ri Jong Son and Kim Pong Suk, a couple of workers of the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Designated by British Political Parties as Their Must Book
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Designated by British Political Parties as Their Must Book
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Bring About Innovations in Agricultural Production under the Unfurled Banner of the Socialist Rural Theses" was designated by the New Communist Party of Britain and the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) as their must book on May 7.
					 The work is the letter sent by him to the participants in the national conference of subworkteam leaders in the agricultural sector on February 6, Juche 103 (2014). 
					
					 The work deals with the sea changes brought about in the socialist rural construction in the DPRK since the publication of the Theses on the Socialist Rural Question (Feb. 25, 1964). It indicates the tasks and ways for finally settling the rural question.

articles.title: Principle of DPRK's Victory: Russian Paper
articles.content:
Principle of DPRK's Victory: Russian Paper
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The 18th issue of the Russian paper Zavtra carried a travelogue on the DPRK contributed by its Editor-in-Chief Alexandr Prokhanov under the title of "Immortality".
					 The paper carried photos documenting the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung and a photo of the statues of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					
					 The author said that the U.S. persists in its malignant accusations and false propaganda against the DPRK, adding he visited the DPRK to lay bare such hostility and false propaganda.
					
					 He said that the DPRK defeated the formidable enemies and did not yield the worldwide pressure but built such society as disallowing the poison harmful to its organic body.
					
					 Pyongyang has been built very harmoniously as a city in a park, he said, giving his impressions of his visit to various places.
					
					 The society of the DPRK is based on the Juche philosophy, he noted, referring the essential contents of the Juche idea and the fact that the Korean people are holding Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal sun.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 One main part of the Juche idea is the idea of self-defence and this serves as the principle of the DPRK's victory. One more keenly feels the principle of this victory when one visits Panmunjom.
					
					 The Armistice Agreement was concluded in the Korean war which started with the attack of south Korea instigated by the U.S. This is the strategic victory and victory of military policies of the DPRK.
					
					 The principle of victory consists of a main content in the DPRK's policies.
					
					 Recollecting the time when he visited the DPRK and met the President in the 1980s, the author expressed his ardent wishes to meet supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Combinado de Maquinaria 18 de Enero y presenta tarea para su modernizacion
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Combinado de Maquinaria 18 de Enero y presenta tarea para su modernizacion
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito el Combinado de Maquinaria 18 de Enero y presento las tareas y metodos detallados para modernizarlo.
					Estuvo primero en el Museo de la Historia Revolucionaria nuevamente construido.
					
					Diciendo que fue acondicionado bien el interior del museo y estan exhibidos bien los datos y los objetos historicos, subrayo que la llave del aumento de produccion esta en la prestacion de gran atencion a la educacion ideologica para movilizar al maximo las fuerzas espirituales de los obreros.
					
					Refiriendo que el combinado desempena el papel medular en el desarrollo de la industria de construccion de maquinaria, destaco que el partido presta suma importancia a ese combinado.
					
					Senalo que el objetivo de su visita es para modernizar la fabrica como modelo vertebral y nuclear que represente las fabricas mecanicas del pais.
					
					Tras exponer la voluntad del partido de modernizarlo al maximo nivel, dio preciosas instrucciones para el fin.
					
					Instruyo que ante todo, debe aplicar la tecnologia de CNC en los procesos productivos y automatizarlos completamente para producir mas las maquinas de alta eficiencia que exigen diversas ramas de la economia nacional y para registrar nuevos exitos en el desarrollo de nuevos articulos.
					
					Luego de definir la meta a ser alcanzada por la fabrica en el futuro no lejano, el Mariscal recalco que el mismo resolvera todos los problemas que se presentan en la modernizacion de la fabrica, tales como el suficiente equipamiento de las ultramodernas instalaciones necesarias.
					
					Ordeno cambiar radicalmente el medioambiente de la fabrica.
					
					Dijo que a partir del punto ded vista y la posicion de construir nuevamente la fabrica, debe separar claramente la zona de produccion y la de vida y levantar de nuevo todos los edificios de produccion y los establecimientos culturales y de servicio publicos.
					
					Agrego que debe construir en el nivel maximo  las instalaciones de servicio publico como el Complejo de Servicios de Higiene Kangsong, y el albergue, casa-cuna y jardin infantil.
					
					Subrayo la necesidad de acondicionar bien la sala de divulgacion de ciencias y tecnologias, para que los cientificos, tecnicos y obreros  aprendan amplios conocimientos cientificos y tecnicos, y de esta manera avivar el fervor del movimiento masivo por la innovacion tecnologia.
					
					Al decir que para perfeccionar el combinado como creacion de eterna duracion hay que dar primordial atencion al diseno y la obra, destaco que enviara el grupo prestigioso de diseno del centro y las competentes fuerzas  de construccion del EPC.
					
					Le acompanaron en la ocasion Hwang Pyong So, Ryom Chol Song, Yun Tong Hyon, Hong Yong Chil y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un inspecciona la unidad 447 de fuerzas aereas y antiaereas de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un inspecciona la unidad 447 de fuerzas aereas y antiaereas de EPC
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, inspecciono la Unidad 447 de las fuerzas aereas y antiaereas del EPC, galardonada con el titulo de Septimo Regimiento de O Jung Hup.
					Tras recibir el parte de recepcion, el Comandante Supremo apreto la mano con cada uno de los comandantes diciendo que vino para ver a los combatientes valientes y los pilotos de la unidad quienes cumplieron bien la dificil mision de vuelo con la determinacion de defender la patria a costa de la vida.
					
					Me siento como en el patio de casa natal cuando vengo a los aeropuertos donde hay centinelas del cielo, expreso.
					
					Dio el maximo reconocimiento a la unidad donde salieron 14 combatientes suicidas destacando que ella es la cuna del espiritu heroico, el de sacrificio y el suicida de los halcones rojos de la Corea del Songun.
					
					Dando vuelta por el monumento a la visita de orientacion de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, recordo con gran emocion la trayectoria orgullosa de la unidad.
					
					Pasando revista al avion visitado por los Generalisimos, evaluo el hecho de que lo cuidan bien y lo mantienen en la perfecta disposicion de despegue, de manera que se pudiera ponerse siempre al frente de los ejercicios de vuelo.
					
					En la casa de ejercicios de vuelo, vio atentamente el entrenamiento de los aviadores con los equipos de pilotaje en la tierra.
					
					Para derramar poca sangre en el tiempo de guerra, hay que ejercitar mucho en el tiempo de paz, instruyo.
					
					Agrego que se debe intensificar los ejercicios para que los aviadores puedan cumplir la mision de combate, inclusive el despegue y aterrizaje, aun en las peores condiciones.
					
					Indico a los pilotos manejar mucho el avion y realizar cotidianamente los ejercicios con modernos equipos de pilotaje, para que se levante en la unidad la ola de entrenamiento por el estilo del monte Paektu.
					
					Para realizar en el terreno los ejercicios en un ambiente de guerra de verdad, es importante fabricar mejor los equipos de pilotaje, dijo y entrego a la unidad los libros de referencia que trajo consigo.
					
					Recorrio el dormitorio de los aviadores y otros puntos prestando profunda atencion a la vida de ellos.
					
					El mismo dia, el Comandante Supremo presencio la funcion artistica de las esposas de los pilotos y combatientes suicidas de la unidad.
					
					Viendo esa funcion modesta y sincera, comprobe la fidelidad de los pilotos de la unidad y sus esposas, dijo y tomo una foto con ellos felicitandoles por la exitosa funcion.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Hwang Pyong So, Ryom Chol Song, Jo Kyong Chol, Yun Tong Hyon, Hong Yong Chil y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a los jefes de Estado de varios paises
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a los jefes de Estado de varios paises
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio mensajes de respuesta a los jefes de Estado de varios paises que le remitieron mensajes de felicitacion en ocasion del dia de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					Entre los destinatarios figuran el presidente de la Republica de la Union de Myanmar, Thein Sein, el presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad, el presidente de la Republica Islamica de Pakistan, Mamnoon Hussain, el presidente de la Republica de Kazajstan, Nursultan Nazarbayev, y el presidente de la Republica de Uganda, Yoweri Kaguta Museveni.
					
					  En sus misivas el Mariscal expreso profundo agradecimiento por las felicitaciones y votos sinceros que le hicieron llegar con motivo del Dia del Sol.
					
					  Expuso la conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y los paises respectivos.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente namibio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente namibio
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le remitiera el 15 de abril el Presidente de la Republica de Namibia, Hifikepunye Pohamba.
					  La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					  Su Excelencia,
					
					  Le extiendo felicitaciones a Su Excelencia en nombre del gobierno y pueblo de Namibia y en el mio propio por su reeleccion como Primer Presidente del CDN de la RPDC.
					
					  La reeleccion de Su Excelencia como Primer Presidente del CDN de la RPDC deviene una expresion de la confianza de su gobierno deseoso de que Su Excelencia siga trabajando por el pueblo de su pais.
					
					  Deseo a Su Excelencia que tenga buena salud y dirija con vigor al pueblo de la RPDC a la mayor prosperidad economica y progreso social.
					
					  Reciba el testimonio de mi mas alta consideracion.
